result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. SAMANTHA LEE PURCHASE

records.addlTxt:
11:24 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant SAMANTHA LEE PURCHASE in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for SAMANTHA LEE PURCHASE. 
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
22CF213, Count 1, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
22CF213, Count 2, Defendant enters guilty plea. 
Factual basis and probable cause found. 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty. 

Counts 3 & 4 DRI. 22CF248, 22CF331, & 22TR1583 DRI. 

Complete booking process.

Court orders: 

Count 1 

Withheld sentence, 36 months probation
Apply to and successfully complete Recovery Court, complete within 90 days
180 days conditional jail, imposed and stayed
If the defendant fails to be accepted into Recovery Court within 90 days of entering plea, State to file motion to impose jail term
drugs, para, norx, shot, noact, assess
$518
DNA

Count 2 

Withheld sentence, 12 months probation, concurrent to count 1 
Same conditions as Count 1. 
$443
DNA

2 days credit if revoked.
Review hearing on July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BOND COVERS 22CF213 (MODIFIED), 22CF248 (MODIFIED), & 22CF331 (NEW)
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia /any syringes unless medically
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs/anv prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs / drug paraphernalia.
Not to possess any knives except for eating purposes.

11:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant SAMANTHA LEE PURCHASE in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for SAMANTHA LEE PURCHASE. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF331. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
22TR1583 to ride along with current matters. 
Complete booking process.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Review hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Review hearing on June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

BOND IN 22CF213 (MODIFIED) TO ALSO APPLY TO 22CF248 (NEW)
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia /any syringes unless medically
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs/anv prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs / drug paraphernalia.
Not to possess any knives except for eating purposes.
